name: The Court - A St Giles Premier Hotel

reviews.text: I have been to NYC 3 times in the past few months for pleasure/business and I have to say this is the worst hotel experience I have had. Not that it was awful, it was not, but just not as pleasant as others. First the good, the rooms were HUGE by NYC standards and the bed was super comfy. The shower products were nice and the pressure in the shower was nice. Now the bad, our comforter(yes I know hotel comforters are gross, but this was more gross than normal) had a stain on it that looked like semen! Super gross. The blind fell off in the middle of the night and woke us up, and the street noise was awful. This may have been because we were on the 3rd floor, but it was hard to fall asleep and we were woken early by the hustle on the street. I will end on a positive. This is on 39th/Lexington and is in walking distance of many good places, so b/c of this, I may consider staying again if I were on a higher floor away from the street, but I would never pay full price. We booked through a discount travel sight, thankfully, as I would never pay $400 for a night in this hotel.
reviews.title: Great location, but that is where the good ends.

reviews.text: Loved the rooms, the atmosphere and the service (bell man, concierge, front desk, phone person were all very friendly). Cleanliness in the rooms need to improve. Location is not trendy, but not far from all the main areas. Overall the value was great, very satisfied for the cost x benefit.
reviews.title: Great value + great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is ideally located and overall a good place to stay. the rooms are HUGE for Manhattan standards and well- appointed. The front desk staff are helpful and very professional. I loved the bed, audio in our room and the overall size of our room.
reviews.title: Awesome locale

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked the hotel through booking.com. We got a good deal for the King size suite, which comprised of a shower/toilet, a walk-in wardrobe and a large king size bed.
reviews.title: 1st wedding anniversary

reviews.text: We found the room clean and modern. The bed was very large and comfortable, the shower unfortunetly leaked at times and required sponging up the water with the towels provided.
reviews.title: Very positive experience!

reviews.text: We found some of the staff were very nonchalent, but overall they were friendly and helpful specially the Juan the consierge. Would recommend a stay at the hotel!
reviews.title: Huge suite featuring a living room and a separate bedroom.

reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews, I was a bit skeptical about this hotel, but my expectations were far surpassed! We had 3 Executive Junior Suites for 6 people (3 couples) from August 30 - September 2, 2012.
reviews.title: small noisy & old hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check-in was a breeze and Jennifer at the front desk provided us with additional information about shopping, popular NYC attractions and more. We then made our way up to our rooms. To the contrary of many reviews, the elevators were not THAT small... The 6 of us and all our luggage fit in one elevator.
reviews.title: Not as good as expected, but some good points.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had just been taken over from previous management, and the transition appeared rocky. As we arrived early, my first impression was of the cafe, which was a strange honor bar system showcasing convenience store/ deli food. When our room WAS ready, though, it did not disappoint. We had a sizable room and a really nice view. While we weren't in NYC to spend time in the room, it was everything we needed, and it was within walking distance to anything we required. Other than a strange first impression, the only real hassle was presented at check out. Somehow the hotel charged my credit card FIVE times, plus the room deposit. It maxed the card that I intended to rent a car with on the next leg of our trip (in another east coast city). The hotel was able to work it our by calling my bank, but it took several hours to straighten out.
reviews.title: Stayed in the midst of a remodel...

reviews.text: I booked this hotel for my daughter and I during our trip to NYC. I contacted the hotel hours before we arrived to confirm our reservation and let them know we were coming into town to celebrate my daughter's 10th birthday. When we arrived, the hotel staff surprised us with a room upgrade and a card and cupcakes for my daughter. We couldn't have been happier with our stay. Our room was comfortable and clean and we were even given complimentary breakfast. To be fair, I booked our room at a discounted rate and we were upgrated to a spacious suite with a balcony and good view, so I'm not sure how the standard rooms compare, but I can't say the staff went above and beyond to make my daughter's weekend special and I'll definitley look to book at this hotel in the future.
reviews.title: Staff Went Above & Beyond

reviews.text: I originally chose the St Giles based on competitive pricing for the NY market and convenient location. I returned for a third time based on the wonderful staff and good quality beds. They have accommodated our early arrivals and late departures with no fuss at all, arranged a shuttle ($20 per person) the one time we departed through Newark's airport, and have upgraded our room on the second and third stay at no charge. Taxi's to LaGuardia ($25 per car) and JFK ($50) are easily flagged at the front door.) The location is a perfect two minute walk from Grand Central and the 4/5/6 subway from there covers all the sights from Central Park and the Museums to the north, all the way through Soho to Wall Street and ground zero to the south. MoMA, Radio City, Times Square, the theater district are a short walk and the Chrysler Building or Empire State will be outside your bedroom window depending on which side of the building you're on. As for the tiniest details, I happen to like the Philosophy brand products they provide. Oddly, there is no coffee pot in the rooms but there are several Starbucks outlets in the immediate surrounding area. The free internet in room makes up for that. I personally don't care about the size of a room as I generally shut my eyes when I sleep and don't spend any time there in the day, but all of my rooms have been as large as any other hotel.
reviews.title: Three great stays...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our short stay here. The rate was excellent, great location 2 blocks from Grand Central Station, room was much bigger and more comfy than expected, although windows needed cleaning, on 6th floor. Incredible view of the Empire State building. Nice staff! We used the valet service to park our car (which we had to have in the city, too bad ) and the service was fast and efficient, but did cost $50. On the other hand, we were able to leave it there for 24 hours, and compared to parking garages in the area...
reviews.title: excellent find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just left a 2 night stay at St Giles. Everything was great, we called the day before for an early check in. We were there super early and dropped off our bags so we could walk around and they called once the room was ready which was great. The room was HUGE, much bigger than any other place we had stayed in before in NYC. Didn't make it to he bar but seemed cool. Walking distance to almost everything.
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.text: My sister and I stayed here for her 30th Birthday in August and couldn't have been happier. We had a beautiful suite with a phenomenal view of the empire state building - couldn't believe our luck when we arrived. The hotel is in a perfect location and within walking distance to all the big sights in Manhattan - we barely had to take cabs at all.
reviews.title: A dream come true hotel - we'll be back!

reviews.text: I had had a very stressful journey flying with United Arilines to New York (my flight was cancelled, bags were lost and I was deserted by the airline) and I couldn't have been looked after better by the hotel. Lovely Maria on the front desk really looked after me - felt like I was being looked after by a member of my own family, and the hotel did everything they could to help me get my bags back. Everyone who works there went out of there way to make our stay perfect, particularly Barbara who was absolutely amazing and so unbelievably friendly - she gave us the best recommendations and looked after us amazingly. We had a fantastic 5 day stay and will be back again soon.Thank you so much for making us feel so welocme!!! xxx
reviews.title: Love the hotel!

reviews.text: It was a challenge going to the hotel as we dont really know how and where to go given that we only walked from Time Square. By the way, its just 2-3 blocks away from Grand Central Station!
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself looks cool and the rooms are big and homey. I love my bed and pillows. They just need to check the toilet bowl as it leaves some residue after you use the flush.
reviews.title: Two blocks from Grand Central

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Iam not sure if David is his name and of course the ever helpful Jennifer Duran!
reviews.title: Je t'aime St. Giles - The Court <3

reviews.text: I stayed at the St Giles Court for only one night and two days in New York after visiting friends in New Jersey State. I thought that I'd take in some of the amazing sights in Manhattan.
reviews.title: Very Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Internet price that I got was good but it was the location that decided it for me. Just a couple of blocks South of Grand Central Terminal.
reviews.title: complimentary upgrade! we had a living room in nyc!

reviews.text: The room was compact but very comfortable with all that I could ask for by way of amenities. A really nice bathroom and shower was all that I hope for.
reviews.title: Dreadful

reviews.text: I enjoyed a really comfortable night's sleep - no problems with noise of any sorts and the staff were very courteous and friendly; I was glad that I chose this hotel and it served as a great base to explore Manhattan from. I did not eat n, but why would you want to with so many great places to eat a short walk, close by.
reviews.title: Terrific customer service, great location, well maintained property.

reviews.text: Maybe I was lucky, but I had a great stay in a nice, clean, well-appointed room; I'd recommend it on location alone.
reviews.title: The room was huge and the shower was great

reviews.text: Stayed in room 1015 for three nites - huge suite with a queen-sized bed and THREE closets. Considering I paid $169 on quikbook for a double room, the upgrade was amazing/wonderful. Partial view of Empire State Building. Room was clean, comfy and huge. It could use a little love: carpets are frayed and bathroom sink was missing hardware. Bed was very comfortable and street noise wasn't bad on the tenth floor (A/C muffled most hotel and street noise - and since bedroom isn't near hallway, it was great not to hear doors slam all the time). Water pressure in shower was good, tho the showerhead sputtered and shook. Two robes in room and plenty of pillows.
reviews.title: Large & comfy room, nice staff, room service $$$ expensive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This could be a really great hotel with a few changes - some minor room updates and more even service. When I arrived, there was no one to open door or greet me. Considering I was schlepping three bags, a little help would have made a great first impression.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an excellent location

reviews.text: Computers were down and check in was delayed til about 3:45, an inconvenience that would've been better tolerated if staff had communicated updates to all travelers waiting. An offer of free wifi and a refreshment would've gone far on a 95-degree day waiting in a lobby.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel!!

reviews.text: Most of the staff encountered were professional and helpful, especially the woman at the front desk who arranged the upgrade to a suite.
reviews.title: Great value for such a plush midtown hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room service charges were outrageous, not a surprise but still always a disappointment to be gouged. There are other hotels, such as the Lucerne on the UWS, that don't feel compelled to rip off customers.
reviews.title: I loved it!!

description: The ultimate New York experience awaits you at The Court. While many hotels leave you feeling claustrophobic, The Court’s 199 spacious guest rooms (Superiors begin at 350 square feet) allow you to spread out in comfort and style. Signature Suites include the Empire Suite, the Chrysler Suite, and our fabulous Terrace Suites, featuring outdoor terraces with views of the city skyline. When you venture out, you will find yourself just steps away from Grand Central Terminal and the iconic Chrysler and Empire State Buildings. Icon Restaurant serves a variety of breakfast options each morning, while Court Bar mixes handcrafted cocktails by night.
